GameDBLocalizedString.Text: The game was saved with mods/addons that aren't currently installed and couldn't be loaded.
Updating (this can take up to a minute)...
Project Hospital uses the Steam web interface to browse for workshop mods and scenarios.\nAfter subscribing to new items please restart the game to allow Steam to download the content
Hospitalization required for the treatment is not available. Check free beds or try a higher priority hospitalization.
Number of contracted insurance companies/allowed contracts
Open clinic at any specialized department
Open hospitalization at any specialized department
Reach prestige {1} at any specialized department
Treat {1} patients per day at any specialized department
Successfully finish {1} event(s) in a row
Have no untreated patients for {1} days
Have no dead patients/lost cases for {1} days
Increase clinic patients per day to {1}
Increase ambulance patients per day to {1}
The employee doesn't have the required specialization for this role, so it can't be enabled
The employee has only one available role, so it can't be disabled
Number of patients sent to the clinic each day.\nThe number gets reduced if the hospital has bad prestige.
ICU accepts only patients with a confirmed diagnosis, collapsed patients without a clear diagnosis go to the Trauma Center (TC).
If examinations and treatments take a long time to start, check if there is enough nurses available for patient transports.
HDU hospitalization is used mostly for immobile patients. It provides more frequent nurse checkups and gives patients better chance to survive collapses.

To perform surgery you need a team with the following specializations: 1x surgeon (doctor), 1x department specialization (doctor), 1x anesthesiology (doctor), 1x medical surgery (nurse), 1x patient care (nurse) - plus a free nurse to transport the patient.
Areas not marked as any room in management mode are considered lowest priority by janitors.
You can extend above-the-ground floors using the foundations tool, they can even go beyond the floor below.
When janitors finish cleaning their department, they will help in another one.
You can move objects with attachments (like a desk with a pc), to select only the attachment, hold [CTRL].
Receptionists assign higher priority to more critical cases during a triage.
No coffee machine in the common room? Seriously? :)
To maximize staff performance you can enable/disable specific roles. You can for example create a dedicated surgery team.
Admit complicated cases for observation, you will also free the doctors at the clinic for other patients.
Hiring someone? Make sure to check their perks!
Carefully placed decorations and clean environment ensure more satisfied employees and patients.
Running out of money? You can take a loan up to $500 000. In the worst case you can even sell some extra equipment or decorations.
If an examination or a treatment is not available, you're probably missing a specialized room or equipment or need to switch the patient to another department.
A good chief doctor can make your staff happier and more efficient.
Prestige influences both insurance payments and patient intake.
Tables of patients and staff can be opened from the left panel in management mode.

If an object turns blue, it is missing some additional equipment. When hovering over the object, the dependencies will be highlighted in building panel. Blue arrows will help you with correct placement.
Table of possible diagnoses will help you find which examinations are necessary to discover specific symptoms.
Average time to see a doctor
Average waiting time for specialized examinations
Night shift at the clinic needs day shift to be staffed first.
Night shift at specialized clinics needs night shift at emergency.
Selected employee doesn't have the specialization needed for this room.
Interns can't be assigned to on-call rooms.

You were not able to complete the event in time or one of your patient was misdiagnosed, died or was transported away. Your prestige dropped for this day or until you successfully complete another event.\nYou are also given a penalty: ${1}
Switch to delete tool in building mode / close unpinned UI panels
Discover different aspects of construction by building a small functional clinic
Learn the rules of hospital management and get acquainted with the hospitalization process
Use your skills to help this inefficient hospital thrive
Will you manage to lead this hospital out of debt?
It's all or nothing. The race for the state grant starts now!
Challenge your skills focused on Emergency department
Challenge your skills focused on General Surgery department
Challenge your skills focused on Internal Medicine department
Challenge your skills focused on Orthopaedy department
Challenge your skills focused on Cardiology department
Challenge your skills focused on Neurology department
This event button will unlock after you purchase an ambulance and make at least one the following departments functional (including night clinic): {1}
User event button will unlock after completing 2nd objective for Quick Snap Care insurance company.
Locked or maximum number of contracted insurance companies is reached (3/3).
can be only placed on ground level
When using management mode as a planning tool, this can be used to mark where elevators will go.
Move a room or selected area
Selection cuts an object in half.
Part of selected area is outside of hospital property.
Increase employee limit to 600 (fast PC needed)

Department doesn't seem to be able to run any more tests, try selecting a different one from to the list of possible diagnoses or making more tests available. Or the patient will be taken to another hospital.
Patient is being transported to another hospital.
Patient waited too long for a diagnosis due to department's inability to run more tests, so the patient is being taken to another hospital.
The clinic has closed for patients, there were still {1} patients waiting.
Patient waited for too long and is leaving!
A clinic patient waited for too long without being seen by a doctor.\nIf there are tests running, the patient will return the next day.
A clinic patient spent half a day in the hospital without being treated or hospitalized.\nIf there are tests running, the patient will return the next day.
Clinic is now open over night!
Clinic is not open over night anymore!
With no doctors serving the night shift, clinic is now only open during the day.
Nurses are complaining that there's not enough stretchers for all patients that need transport at {1}.
Patient can't be released from observation!
A patient should continue to {1} clinic, but it's currently closed. We'll try to hospitalize the patient at the department instead.

Character did not find a way, because there might be something blocking it.\nCharacter will try to find a new way, if there is any. But be sure to check for missing doors, blocked elevators or restricted areas along the way.
There is no doctor in on call room on {1} with diagnostic role enabled for hospitalized patients.
Can't be prescribed at this department
You successfully equipped all required rooms, but it seems that you forgot to place a door. Place doors everywhere where they are needed.

Rooms are divided between mandatory (red number) and optional rooms (green number). Some rooms are shared between departments. Let's place one of each: a doctor's office, a waiting room and a restroom, these are needed for a working clinic.
Workspaces consist of a desk, a chair and a pc and when built correctly, they will show up in management mode. You hire your employees through them. They show both day and night shift.
Let's have a look at your hiring options. Click on any empty workspace (without the portrait), to open up the hiring card.
You hire an employee by clicking on their portrait. You can also assign any workplace from the employee card. After hiring an employee you can see their allowed roles on their workspace.
Let's have a closer look at your staff. Open any of your employee's card. \n\nClick either on occupied workspace in management mode or directly on employee in game mode.
Let's take a quick look at management tools for the whole hospital. Open hospital management card by clicking on any of the categories on the main panel.
This card contains 5 categories: Department statistics, Insurance, Ambulances, Budget and Statistics. Check them often because they will give you feedback you need for running an efficient hospital.

It's time to hire a surgeon for the day shift in the on-call room. If you hover over the professions, tooltips will advise you which specialization is required. They can be filtered in the hiring card. \n\nAll of the red warning signs must be dealt with to have clinic and hospitalization functional.
Now when we've covered the basics, it's time to get this clinic going. Treat 4 patients.\n\nYou can check the number of treated patients (green) on the main panel.
Another great way to boost money income and also prestige is to successfully complete events in a row. But be careful because failing can have the opposite outcome.
Click on a workplace in your chosen room. Left side for day shift, right side for night shift.
Choose which profession you need.\n\nTip: mandatory professions are highlighted in red, recommended in yellow.
Select one of the available employees and they will be assigned to the workplace.\n\nTip: be aware of their perks.
Here you can see all insurance companies that can be contracted.\n\nTip: there is a limit of max 3 contracts at the same time.
Every company also shows you how many patients they're sending per day.\n\nTip: you can increase those numbers by finishing company objectives.

In certain rooms you can see workload value, representing work over the last 24h. None means that staff in this room had nothing to do, critical means that your staff is overloaded.\n\nTip: workload summary for each department is available in department statistics.

Fully equiped laboratory capable to provide blood and serology related tests.

Min. Staff requirements:
1x Technologist

Fully equiped laboratory capable to provide cultivation and testing of various samples.

Min. Staff requirements:
1x Technologist

Fully equiped laboratory capable to provide microscopic analysis of various samples.

Min. Staff requirements:
1x Technologist
Common laboratory shelf - mounted on the wall
Specialized equipment involved in cultivation of bacterias and/or fungus.
Specialized laboratory equipment used to limit exposure to hazardous or toxic fumes, vapors or dusts.

Microbial sampling is the collection of samples from the patient (e.g. body fluids, sputum, stool) for further analysis. 

Required room: Microbiology Lab 

Sampling: Emergency dpt / General Surgery dpt / Internal Medicine dpt / Neurology dpt / ICU 

Required equipment: Glassware + Fume hood + Microbiolog. incubator + Microscope
Laboratory cultivation of the specific sample obtained from the patient in order to determine if bacterias are present and which kind of bacteria it is. \n\nRequired room: Microbiology Lab

A surgical procedure where a piece of tissue (e.g. lung, liver, intestine) is taken out for further testing. 

Required room: Histology Lab 

Sampling: Emergency dpt / General Surgery dpt / Orthopaedy dpt / Cardiology dpt / Neurology dpt / ICU 

Required equipment: Glassware + Lab analyzer + Microscope

The piece of tissue that was taken our during the biopsy procedure is examined under a microscope and treated with various preparations for allow for more specific testing. \n\nRequired room: Histology Lab

The collection of a sample of the patient's blood (venous or arterial) for further analysis or testing. 

Required room: Hematology Lab 

Sampling: Any department 

Required equipment: Glassware + Hematoanalyzer
Laboratory analysis of a blood sample. \n\nRequired room: Hematology Lab

The sampling of blood for a Complete Blood Count (CBC) test. 

Required room: Hematology Lab 

Sampling: Emergency dpt / General Surgery dpt / Internal Medicine dpt / Orthopaedy dpt / Neurology dpt / ICU 

Required equipment: Glassware + Hematoanalyzer
Complete Blood Count (CBC) test counts all of the cells found in the blood and determines if there is an increase or decrease in any of those cells. \n\nRequired room: Hematology Lab

The collection of a stool sample from the patient in order to quantify the amount of the elastase produced by the pancreas. It indicates the actual function of the pancreas. 

Required room: Hematology Lab 

Sampling: Emergency dpt / General Surgery dpt / ICU 

Required equipment: Glassware + RIA
The measurement of elastase in a stool sample from a patient. The amount indicates the actual function of the pancreas. \n\nRequired room: Hematology Lab

Collecting various samples from the patient's body for cultivation in order to determine if fungal species are present or not. 

Required room: Microbiology Lab 

Sampling: Emergency dpt / ICU 

Required equipment: Glassware + Fume hood + Microbiolog. incubator + Microscope
Laboratory cultivation of the specific samples obtained from the patient's body. \n\nRequired room: Microbiology Lab

Sampling of biological material for polymerase chain reaction analysis in the laboratory. Examination is quick, cheap and exact. 

Required room: Hematology Lab 

Sampling: All departments 

Required equipment: Glassware + Thermal cycler
Polymerase chain reaction is quick examination method of identifying infectious disease caused by bacteria or viruses. Examination is quick, cheap and exact. \n\nRequired room: Hematology Lab

Sampling of peritoneal fluid with a large needle and syringe through the abdominal wall. 

Required room: Histology Lab 

Sampling: General Surgery dpt 

Required equipment: Glassware + Medical centrifuge + Lab analyzer
Biochemical test that analyzes the fluid collected from the peritoneal space. \n\nRequired room: Histology Lab

Drawing of a blood sample for serologic tests. 

Required room: Hematology Lab 

Sampling: All departments 

Required equipment: Glassware + RIA
Special blood test examining specific antibodies and antigens. Antibodies are proteins made by human immune system to neutralize pathogens. \n\nRequired room: Hematology Lab

Sampling of cerebrospinal fluid is performed by inserting a needle through the lower back into the spinal canal, draining a small amount of cerebrospinal fluid. 

Required room: Histology Lab 

Sampling: Neurology dpt 

Required equipment: Glassware + Medical centrifuge + Lab analyzer
Process of analysis of cerebrospinal fluid in the laboratory. \n\nRequired room: Histology Lab

Procedure to collect a sample of patient's stool for further analysis. 

Required room: Histology Lab 

Sampling: Emergency dpt / General Surgery dpt / Internal Medicine dpt / ICU 

Required equipment: Glassware + Stool analyzer
Analysis of the patient's stool for bacteria, blood, parasites etc. \n\nRequired room: Histology Lab

Sampling of mid-stream urine from a patient, or from a patient's catheter. 

Required room: Histology Lab 

Sampling: Emergency dpt / General Surgery dpt / Internal Medicine dpt / Cardiology dpt / ICU 

Required equipment: Glassware + Lab analyzer
Biochemical analysis of a urine sample. \n\nRequired room: Histology Lab
Electromyography (EMG) is the recording and evaluation of the electrical activity of the patient's muscles. \n\nRequired room: Office/Diagnostic unit at Orthopaedy dpt
